page.title: 16THE ORGANIST'S VIEW
page.content:
As the organist at Chiddingly I meet many people. Although the town is widely spread out there is usually a good turn out on a Sunday. The types of people range from the fanatical religous to the Â£I suppose I better go to chuch as it's Christmas !'.
Every year in August or October the Chiddingly Music Festival is held in the church. This is a big festival which attracts performers from all round the county and is often recorded for broadcasting on the radio.
Chiddingly is a close knit community and I feel priveliged to be accepted as one of them since coming from outside only a year ago.
